medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 day prior to presentation after eating a lobster roll and drinking a glass of wine. She experienced epigastric discomfort and nausea, vomiting 3 times that day and 3 times on the day of presentation. Appetite significantly decreased.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on coumadin, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, facial cellulitis.
medical_history.family_history: Two siblings with atrial fibrillation and hypertension. One sibling with diabetes mellitus. One sibling with coronary artery disease status post CABG. Mother with diabetes mellitus and uterine cancer. Father died from myocardial infarction.
